isis.stitle: AFC 97904 - Installation Procedure of Center Mount Hood Hinge Kits

afc.subject: Installation Procedure of Center Mount Hood Hinge Kits

geninfo.para: This AFC applies to abovementioned models used in On/Off Road or Off Road applications.

A center mount hood hinge retrofit kit is available for 9300 Models built between June, 1994 and July, 1997 that experience severe front end articulation due to on/off road or off road applications. The kit includes all necessary components to convert an outboard mounted hood to a center mounted hood.

entry.para: Special Flat Head Mach. Screw, 1/2-20 UNF X 1-3/4
Hood Hinge Pivot Cross Bar Reinforcement Plate

step1.para: Remove the front bumper ( Item 1, Figure 1) from the bumper mounting brackets, or from the bumper reinforcement channel (Item 2, Figure 1) and remove bumper reinforcement channel, if so equipped. Save the bumper and bumper reinforcement channel for re-installation.
Remove 2 pan head screws ( Item 1, Figure 2) from the top flange and 2 pan head screws ( Item 2, Figure 2) from underneath the bottom flange of the lower grille surround ( Item 3, Figure 2).

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Remove the cotter pins ( Item 1, Figure 3) (and washers, if so equipped) at the tilt assist spring brackets ( Item 2, Figure 3) on top of the radiator ( Item 3, Figure 3), on both sides.

calloutgroup.callout1: 8. HEX BOLT AND HEX LOCK NUT, 5/16-18 UNC X 2 INCHES

step1.para: Pull out the retaining pins ( Item 4, Figure 3) that secure the tilt assist spring assemblies ( Item 5, Figure 3) to the tilt assist spring brackets ( Item 2, Figure 3) on top of the radiator, on both sides.
Remove the hood shock absorber ( Item 6, Figure 3) from the radiator shock absorber bracket ( Item 7, Figure 3) by removing the hex bolt and hex lock nut ( Item 8, Figure 3).
Disconnect the wiring harness connections near the radiator, driver side; wiring harness stays with the hood.
Carefully tilt the hood assembly to full open position and support the hood assembly on suitable floor stands that will allow the hood assembly to be moved slightly forward.
Remove from inside the hood, 3 hex nuts, lockwashers and flat washers ( Item 1, Figure 4). Then from outside the hood, remove the 3 carriage bolts from the upper hood hinges ( Item 2, Figure 4).

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HEX NUT, LOCKWASHER AND FLAT WASHER
3. FLANGED HEAD BOLT AND HEX FLANGED NUT

step1.para: Remove flanged head bolts and nuts ( Item 3, Figure 4) securing the right and left side hinge brackets with lower hood hinges ( Items 4 and 5, Figure 4) to the frame rail brackets ( Item 6, Figure 4). Now remove the upper and lower hood hinges with hinge brackets as one, and lay out of the way (not reused).

Remove the lower grille surround ( Item 3, Figure 2) by removing from inside the hood, 2 lock nuts and flat washers ( Item 4, Figure 2), 1 each side. Then from outside the hood, remove the 2 carriage bolts ( Item 5, Figure 2) and remove lower grille surround and lay out of the way (not reused).

To remove the lower grille bracket ( Item 1, Figure 5) remove from inside the hood, 3 lock nuts and flat washers ( Item 2, Figure 5) across the bottom of the grille opening. Then from outside the hood, remove the right and left side carriage bolts ( Item 3, Figure 5) from the grille insert assembly and lower grille bracket ( Items 4 and 1, Figure 5). Remove the center carriage bolt and spacer ( Items 5 and 6, Figure 5). This will allow the wiring harness loop clamps to be removed.
Remove the lower grille bracket ( Item 1, Figure 6) by removing 2 hex bolts and lock nuts and 4 flat washers ( Items 2 and 3, Figure 6). Lay lower grille bracket out of the way (not reused).

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. HEX BOLT, 1/4-20 X 1/-1/2 INCHES AND FLAT WASHER

step1.para: Position the new hood hinge support assembly ( Item 1, Figure 7) across the front of the vehicle with the angle bracket ( Item 2, Figure 7) on top of the driver side bumper mounting bracket ( Item 3, Figure 7). Slide the towing hooks through the hood hinge support assembly into the mounting holes to help hold it in place.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. FLAT HEAD MACHINE SCREW, 1/2-20 UNF X 1-3/4 INCHES AND HEX FLANGED LOCK NUT, 1/2-20 UNF
6. FLANGED HEAD BOLT, 1/2-20 UNF X 1/-1/2 INCHES AND HEX FLANGED LOCK NUT, 1/2-20 UNF
8. HEX BOLT AND FLAT WASHER, 1/2-13 UNC X 2-3/4 INCHES

step1.para: Install the flat head machine screw ( Item 4, Figure 7) securing the hood hinge support assembly ( Item 1, Figure 7) to the passenger side bumper mounting bracket ( Item 5, Figure 7) and install hex flanged lock nut ( Item 4, Figure 7). Then install 1 flanged head bolt ( Item 6, Figure 7), removed earlier while removing the lower hood hinge and hinge bracket, securing the hood hinge support assembly angle bracket ( Item 2, Figure 7) to the driver side bumper mounting bracket ( Item 3, Figure 7) and install hex flanged lock nut ( Item 6, Figure 7). Make sure the towing hooks slide in and out smoothly and tighten the machine screw and flanged head bolt and hex flanged lock nuts ( Items 4 and 6, Figure 7) to 110 to 120 ft-lbs. (149 to 163 Nm).
If used, remove the towing hooks and lay them aside before continuing.
If so equipped, re-install the bumper reinforcement channel ( Item 2, Figure 1) to the new hood hinge support assembly ( Item 1, Figure 7).

Position the front bumper ( Item 7, Figure 7) in place, slide the towing hooks into the mounting holes to help hold it in place and start installing the hex bolts with flat washers ( Item 8, Figure 7) through the bumper, bumper spacers and hood hinge support assembly ( Items 7, 9 and 1, Figure 7). Make sure tow hooks do not contact bumper openings, this will damage bumper when used. Tighten to 75 to 85 ft-lbs. (102 to 115 Nm).

Before installing the new hood hinge pivot cross bar ( Item 1, Figure 8) in place across the lower inside part of the hood and grille opening, cut off the inside edge (grille side) of the front fender reinforcement ( Item 2, Figure 8) and mud guard as needed on both right and left inner fender to allow the new hood hinge pivot cross bar to fit.

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. HEX NUT, 3/8-16 UNC, FLAT WASHER AND LOCKWASHER
7. HEX NUT, 3/8-16 UNC, FLAT WASHER AND LOCKWASHER

step1.para: Install both new lower hood hinges ( Item 1, Figure 9) on the outer surface of the lower hood hinge bracket ( Item 2, Figure 9) of the new hood hinge support assembly ( Item 3, Figure 9) and install hex bolts, lockwashers and flat washers ( Item 4, Figure 9). Tighten to finger tight to allow for hood adjustment.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. HEX BOLT, 1/2-13 UNC X 2 INCHES, LOCKWASHER AND FLAT WASHER
9. THREADED HINGE PIN AND HEX CROWN NUT

step1.para: Install the hood hinge pin spacers ( Item 5, Figure 9) into the hood hinge insulators ( Item 6, Figure 9) and place them in the hood hinge pivot cross bar ( Item 7, Figure 9) and secure with hex bolt ( Item 8, Figure 9).

Position the hood hinge pivot cross bar ( Item 1, Figure 8) in place inside the hood, then position the hinge pivot reinforcement plates ( Item 3, Figure 8) on the outside of the hood where the upper hood hinge was located.

Install 4 carriage bolts ( Item 4, Figure 8), 2 each side, in the 2 bottom holes of the hinge pivot reinforcement plates, hood panels and hood hinge pivot cross bar ( Items 3, 8, 9 and 1, Figure 8) and install 4 flat washers, lockwashers and hex nuts ( Item 5, Figure 8), 2 each side, then install 2 carriage bolts ( Item 6, Figure 8), 1 each side, in the top hole of the hinge pivot reinforcement plates, hood panels and hood hinge pivot cross bar ( Items 3, 8, 9 and 1, Figure 8). Position the wiring harness loop clamps over the carriage bolts and install 2 flat washers, lockwashers and hex nuts ( Item 7, Figure 8), 1 each side. Tighten to 21 to 27 ft-lbs. (29 to 37 Nm).

Position the new lower grille bracket ( Item 1, Figure 10) behind the grille insert assembly mounting bars and on the hood hinge pivot cross bar ( Item 2, Figure 10), then install the hex bolts ( Item 3, Figure 10) through the lower grille bracket and hood hinge pivot cross bar and install the flat washers and lock nuts ( Item 4, Figure 10). Tighten to 90 to 100 in-lbs. (10 to 11 Nm).

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. HEX BOLT, 1/4-20 X 1-1/2 INCHES AND FLAT WASHER

step1.para: Line up the lower mounting holes of the grille insert assembly ( Item 1, Figure 11) with the grille mounting holes in the lower grille bracket ( Item 2, Figure 11), and from outside the hood, install the right and left side carriage bolts ( Item 3, Figure 11). Also install the center carriage bolt ( Item 4, Figure 11) through the grille, spacer ( Item 5, Figure 11) and lower grille bracket, then from inside the hood, install the flat washers and lock nuts ( Item 6, Figure 11). Tighten to 90 to 100 in-lbs. (10 to 11 Nm).

Position the new lower grille trim ( Item 1, Figure 12) in place and from outside the hood, install the 2 carriage bolts ( Item 3, Figure 12), 1 each side. Then from inside the hood, install the flat washers and lock nuts ( Item 2, Figure 12), both sides. Tighten to 70 to 80 in-lbs. (8 to 9 Nm).

Move the hood on the floor stands, into position, line up the lower hood hinge with the hood hinge insulators and spacers ( Items 5 and 6, Figure 9) in the hood hinge pivot cross bar ( Item 7, Figure 9) and install the threaded hinge pins ( Item 9, Figure 9). Then install a hex crown nut ( Item 9, Figure 9) on both ends of the threaded hinge pins. Tighten to 50 to 55 ft-lbs. (68 to 75 Nm).

Carefully close the hood and install the 2 pan head screws ( Item 4, Figure 12) on the top flange and the 2 pan head screws ( Item 5, Figure 12) on the underside of the bottom flange of the lower grille trim ( Item 1, Figure 12).
Carefully open the hood and connect the wiring harness connections near the radiator, driver side.

Adjust the lower hood hinges ( Item 4, Figure 13) up or down ( Item 2, Figure 13) and forward or back ( Item 3, Figure 13) to meet the hood-to-cowl 3/4 inch spacing specification; use the following procedure.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. ADJUST IN DIRECTION OF ARROW UP OR DOWN
3. ADJUST IN DIRECTION OF ARROW FORWARD OR BACK

para.title: 9300 - Hood Adjustment Up or Down and Forward or Back at the Lower Hood Hinges

note.para: The Hood-to-Cowl adjustment dimension is 3/4 inch (19 mm) minimum.

caution.para: To prevent damage to the hood, be sure the hood assembly is supported on an appropriate floor stand.

step1.para: Make 4 wood spacer blocks ( Figure 14) that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

Reach underneath the bumper and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the hinge adjustment bolts ( Item 1, Figure 13) and push the hood forward and down ( Items 3 and 2, Figure 13) at both hinges ( Item 4, Figure 13).
Position 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange ( Figure 14). Use the other 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks to check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side.

Carefully close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks ( Figure 14). Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and are sitting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks, push the hood up or down ( Item 2, Figure 13) at both hinges ( Item 4, Figure 13) to meet the hood-to-bumper spacing of approximately 2.14 inches (54.39 mm) between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper. Check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side with the other 2 spacer blocks.

When the hood-to-cowl and hood-to-bumper dimensions are properly set, and the bottom front edge of the hood is parallel to the line of the bumper, tighten the 2 hinge adjustment bolts ( Item 1, Figure 13) on each hinge.

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies during installation, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Position the tilt assist spring assemblies ( Item 5, Figure 15) at the tilt assist spring brackets ( Item 2, Figure 15) on top of the radiator ( Item 3, Figure 15), on both sides.

calloutgroup.callout1: 8. HEX BOLT AND HEX LOCK NUT, 5/16-18 UNC X 2 INCHES

step1.para: Install the retaining pins ( Item 4, Figure 15) (and washers, if so equipped).

Install the cotter pins ( Item 1, Figure 15) in the retaining pins ( Item 4, Figure 15) securing the tilt assist spring assemblies to the tilt assist spring brackets ( Item 2, Figure 15) on top of the radiator, on both sides.

Install the hood shock absorber ( Item 6, Figure 15) at the radiator shock absorber bracket ( Item 7, Figure 15) by installing the hex bolt and hex lock nut ( Item 8, Figure 15). Tighten to 240 to 265 in-lbs. (27 to 30 Nm).
Remove the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

laborinfo.para: Operation number must appear on all claims.

entry.para: Install center mount hood hinge kit

claims.para: Expense is to be charged to Warranty. Claims are to be submitted in the normal manner, making reference to Authorized Field Change Number G-97904.

It is important that the coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to items 39 through 44.

To assure this important improvement is made in a timely manner, all claims for G-97904 activity must be submitted by October 31, 1998 or within the normal warranty period for the vehicle, if after October 31, 1998.
